intro: Conopodium mutabile, commonly known as the variable bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and distinctive seed pods that resemble bladders. It typically grows in moist soils along stream banks and wetlands. Conopodium mutabile is often found in disturbed habitats and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
